body: is a1df7bf91666c9fe367ba9932be37158f39de684 enough? or do you want to change the messages as well ?

It's definitely much better than before! Though there are still some issues... Here's what I currently see when there's a timeout during `setup()`:
```
ERRO[0010] Setup timeout                                 error="setup: Timeout during setup"
ERRO[0010] Setup timeout
```

It's... both a bit much and not enough at the same time :smile: We say setup timeout 3 times for some reason, and even though that's much better than the previous `setup: context cancelled at setup`, here's what I would improve with the above picture:
- Don't repeat the same thing 3 times :grin: I hadn't noticed those `log.WithError(err).Error(basicallySameErr)` statements in the error handling code before...
- The message `setup: Timeout during setup` could be rephrased as `Timeout during setup() execution`
- Even better, `setup() execution timed out after X seconds`

Here's a proposal how the above scenario could look like:
```
ERRO[0010] setup() execution timed out after 10 seconds         hint="You can increase the time limit via the setupTimeout option"
```

issue.title: lib: better error message for timeout error

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
TimeoutError is currently very uninformative, even if there are
duplicated error messages.

This PR change TimeoutError to a struct, which contains both the place
and the timeout duration, so it helps constructing error message with
more useful information to user.

While at it, also prevent duplicating timeout error message for setup
and teardown.

Close #702

body:
Hmm not sure this is fully fixed. k6 v0.25.1 produced this output:
```
ERRO[0002] Setup timeout                                 error="setup: Timeout during setup"
ERRO[0002] Setup timeout   
```

the latest k6 `master` again produced 2 separate error messages for the same timeout, though I admit the first message is much, much better :heart: :
```
ERRO[0002] setup: setup execution timed out after 2 seconds  hint="You can increase the time limit via the setupTimeout option"
ERRO[0002] Setup timeout
```
@na-- We can't prevent the second `Setup timeout`, it' from https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/19c6796b3f4f9d7d96a3c7ef88ee7b651eba3bb3/cmd/run.go#L412

You should have linked the broader context, since I'm not sure there isn't any room for improvement in this code :smile: https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/19c6796b3f4f9d7d96a3c7ef88ee7b651eba3bb3/cmd/run.go#L408-L422

Maybe we should extend the `ExitCode` struct so that when k6 aborts with an `ExitCode`, so that it can also give hints? Not sure if that's the best way to handle this, but for sure we should be able to have something better and fully solve this (and other similar issue), even though this isn't a `high prio` issue...

I've set `lower prio` and `refactoring` labels here, since even though we can slightly improve the code and UX here, the current state is more than good enough for now, given what we started with. We can come back and fix the remaining details at some future point, even after 0.26.0.

issue.title: Provide decent stack traces in setup code

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.title: Fix duplicated error messages

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
If RootCmd.Execute returns any error, we always log that error. So
removing log from child command before returning to prevent duplicated
error message printed.

This PR also adds Hint field to ExitCode, to provide hint/details for
the underlying error. It helps the logger keep the semantic and provide
meaningful error message to user.

Updates #994
Fixes #702
